RequirementText: The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved within 5 seconds. The save shall occur within 5 seconds.
Only adjusters can request recycled parts audit reports. No users without an adjuster role shall request recycled parts audits.
Only adjusters with a supervisor role can update preferred repair facility ratings. Users without the supervisor role cannot access the repair facility ratings.
Only collision estimators shall search for recycled parts. Users without the collision estimator role shall not have access to the search for recycled parts.
The user shall search for the preferred repair facility using vehicle vehicle location and radius in miles
The system shall locate the preferred repair facility with the highest ratings for the input criteria
The adjuster shall enter the preferred repair facility on the estimate assignment.
The adjuster shall be able to override the preferred repair facitlity on the estimate assignment.
The preferred repair facility shall be returned to the user.
The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using damaged vehicle parts information.
The estimator shall search for available recycled parts using a list of preferred parts suppliers.
The system shall search for available recycled parts for the supplied vehicle parts and suppliers.
The available recycled parts information and their suppliers shall be returned to the user.
The estimator shall apply selected recycled parts to the collision estimate.
The adjuster shall review the collision estimate.
The adjuster shall request a recycled parts audit of the collision estimate.
The recycled parts search results provided to the estimator shall be retrieved by the system.
The system shall generate an audit report based on the available recycled parts and the collision estimate.
The audit report shall be displayed to the user.
The current repair facility ratings shall be displayed to the user.
The preferred repair facility ratings shall be saved by the system.
The product shall allow the user to select a chosen language from one of the target market countries.
The product shall create an exception log of problems encountered within the product for transmission to our company for analysis and resolution.
Only managers are able to perform search queries for reservations by user. 100% of all search queries for reservations by user shall be from logons of only management logons.

The product shall be able to display calendar dates and times according to the user's locale. 90% of survey respondents from each target market country will find that the date and time formatting of the product is correct.
The product shall record meeting entries.
The product will notify employees of meeting invitations.
The product shall have the ability to send meeting reminders to employees.
The product shall assign the organizers contact information to each meeting they create.
The product will record meeting acknowledgements.
The product shall store new conference rooms.
The product shall update existing conference rooms.
The product will be able to delete conference rooms.
The product shall be able to store new room equipment.
The product will update existing room equipment.
The product shall be able to delete room equipment.
The product shall allow an organizer to invite other employees to meetings.
The product shall record the transportation status of equipment reserved.
The product shall display a map of the company building showing conference room locations.
The product shall record updated meeting agendas.
All users should be able to navigate using the sub navigation icons to access the Catalogue PDF, 360 videos, and to contact a representative.
User enters his/her username or email and his/her password and logs in the system.
User touches log out button, and logs out of the system. The user will not use the system until he/she logs in again.
User is able to browse the profiles other users. User can see the other users’ user names, profile photos, and the users’ items.

user is able to browse categories according to his/her wishes. User can also see
how many items each category has.

user is able browse items. User can see the items’ pictures, prices, and other
features.

If the user changes his/her username or password, a notification mail will be sent to the
user’s email address.
The changes will apply if the user clicks on the link in the email.

User can buy credits from the system. He/she can use credit card or his/her
PayPal account.
User can add the items he/she likes to his cart by touching Add to the cart button.

If the item the user wants is available for exchange, the user can request the
exchange of items that he/she has with the item he/she wants.
The user can approve the exchange that is offered by another user by clicking Approve button.
The user can decline the exchange that is offered by another user by clicking Decline button.
The user notifies other user that the shipment of the item has started.
The user can add as many as items he/she wants.
The user can also set the price, set the amount, upload pictures of the item and add details of the item.
The user can edit the items that he/she has already put on the system. The user can add/remove pictures, change the price and details of the item.
If the user no longer wishes to sell/exchange the item, he/she can remove the item from the system by touching Remove the item button.

If the user no longer wishes to use the system, he/she can click Delete Profile
button. After deleting the profile, the user will no longer be able to use the system with the account details that he entered before.
The user can mark an item as a favorite so that he will be notified if any change is made to the item.
The user can rate and comment about the users whom he traded with.
Build the search engine based on the search form and sites available.
User should be able to search by site name, description.
System should be self capable with feature of Auto Suggest.
System should be able to return the search results in descending order in the form of list of links to the sites.
System should be able to  display No results found in case no search results found.
System should have a link back to home in case no results found.
Geo-location feature to be able to find a user.
Use Geolocation scripts to locate user.
Check if user is within 1 mile of the campus.
If user within 1 mile of the campus , update location.
User for permission to use the location service.
If the user denied to user the location service, prompt the user to home screen.
If user allows location service, create the user.
If the system unable to update the location , Show failure message and return the user to home page.
Update Page with link to sites nearby.
Build Ajax Response to update home page with a link to nearby site based on user location.
Application should respond with a list of links to the 3 nearest sites by A-Z, sorted by name.
Application should respond with the sites placed on a map with markers that includes name, description and link to site page.
Application should do the distance calculations and geolocation information for user/site and nearby sites.
When user clicks on links to browse sites from home page, the system should respond with a list of links to all the sites by A-Z, sorted on site name
Application should collect list of all sites sorted by name.
Application should build URL to each site’s page.
When user clicks on link to map sites from the home page, application should respond with a campus map with all the historical sites placed on it
Each historical site should have a marker for each site placed on map that include the name, shorten description, and link to the site page.
The site’s page should contain link to walking directions on tour.
Application should respond with a list of thumbnail images for the site, listed from oldest to newest by year.
In case no image available, application should return no image flag.
When user clicks on a thumbnail image from the site’s page, the application should replace the site’s image with the medium sized clicked on image.
Application should replace the site’s description with the clicked on image description.
When the user clicks on the main image on the site’s page, application should return with a an enlarged version of the image.
When User clicks on link to Walking Tour application should  respond with walking tour page.
When user clicks on link to About, application should respond with About page.
No personal data about a user is stored.
User location information should be deleted nightly via a job.
The administrator can change text elements used in the user interfaces of the sub-apps and main-app (this does not include the external resources).
The language can only be selected in the main app.
The default language of insApption is English.
The M&C shall perform validity check  before commanding the DBMS to distribute the Config files incl. D/L Keys.
The M&C shall perform validity check  before commanding the DBMS to distribute the P/L Config Files incl. D/L Keys and Forward Tasking Data.
The M&C shall perform validity check before commanding the DBMS to distribute the Config File.
The M&C shall perform validity check before commanding the DBMS to distribute the Config Files or Forward Tasking Data confirmation.
The M&C shall periodically check the of the network elements by using the ping command.
The M&C shall periodically poll CSM data from the Ground Stations on SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall periodically poll max 5 predefined, fixed Ground Stations performance parameters from the DB.
The M&C shall periodically poll the availability of the Local M&C via SNMPv2c.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for EDRS Satellite monitoring information.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for EDTS CSM information.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for link process changes.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for logs from MOC Components.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for MOC equipment and MOC component status changes.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for the availability of LEO orbit S/C files.
The M&C shall periodically poll the DBMS for the availability of the Forward Tasking Data.
The M&C shall periodically poll the EDRS Components for their availability during operations.
The M&C shall periodically poll the Satellite Control Center component status using SNMPv2c.
The M&C shall periodically poll the Satellite Control Center for EDRS satellite monitoring information using SNMPv2c.
The M&C shall periodically poll the status of the Ground Stations via SNMPv2c.
The M&C shall poll BFLGS status data using SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll EDRS Components for alarms using the SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll EDRS Components for events using the SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll FLGS status data using SNMPv2c interface
The M&C shall poll HDGS status data using SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll periodically the DBMS for Satellite Control Center Forward Tasking Data Confirmation.
The M&C shall poll periodically the DBMS for Satellite Control Center Forward Tasking Data Upload Confirmation.
The M&C shall poll RDGS status data using SNMPv2c interface
The M&C shall poll the component periodically.
The M&C shall poll the DB for EDRS Satellite anomalies provided by the SSM having an impact on execution and link quality.
The M&C shall poll the DB for EDRS Satellite anomalies provided by the SSM.
The M&C shall poll the DB for status information of the dispatching.
The M&C shall poll the DB for the time to upload the Forward tasking data to the Satellite Control Center.
The M&C shall poll the DB to retrieve the satellite switchover event.
The M&C shall poll the DBMS for CSM data received from the CSM Ground Station.
The M&C shall poll the DBMS for European Data Relay Satellite payload anomalies.
The M&C shall poll the DBMS for Forward Tasking Data Confirmation.
The M&C shall poll the DBMS for Satellite Control Centre Forward Tasking Data deletion command acknowledgement.
The M&C shall poll the DBMS for the European Data Relay Satellite anomalies.
The M&C shall poll the execution and completion status of the scheduled activities from DBMS.
The M&C shall poll the Satellite Control Centers and Ground Stations only after authentication.
The M&C shall poll the status of the DPCC from the SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll the status of the SCC from the SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall poll UGS status data using SNMPv2c interface.
The M&C shall present  to the MOC operator the events.
The M&C shall present the CSM data to the MOC operator for a visual quality evaluation.
The M&C shall present the CSM information for visual link quality evaluation to MOC Operator.
The M&C shall present the operator with audible notification in case an alarm arises in the Ground Station or the Satellite Control Center.
The M&C shall present the operator with visual notification in case an alarm arises in the Ground Station or the Satellite Control Center.
The M&C shall present to the MOC operator European Data Relay Satellite payload anomalies.
The M&C shall present to the MOC Operator the alarms.
The M&C shall present to the MOC operator the European Data Relay Satellite anomalies
The M&C shall present to the MOC operator the link process changes latest 30s after its availability in the DBMS.
The M&C shall present to the MOC operator the MOC equipment or MOC component status changes latest 30s after its availability in the DBMS.
The M&C shall process internally the Forward Tasking Data set replacement if no Forward Tasking Data set has been uploaded already.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to reuse in an assurance project evidence traceability link types defined in another project.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to select an existing evidence characterization model for an assurance project.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to send emails containing information about actions to perform in an assurance project as a result of evidence evaluation.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to send emails containing information about actions to perform in an assurance project as a result of evidence item changes.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify actions required in the body of evidence of an assurance project as a result of an evidence item change.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify actions required in the body of evidence of an assurance project as a result of evidence evaluation.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify evidence traceability links between evidence items of an assurance project.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify evidence traceability links in traceability matrices.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify evidence traceability links in traceability tables.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to specify the rationale behind the evaluation of an evidence item of an assurance project.
The OPENCOSS platform shall provide users with the ability to use in an assurance project evidence types that have been defined in another project.
The OPENCOSS platform shall record if the status of an action required in an assurance project as a result of evidence evaluation is pending or addressed.
The OPENCOSS platform shall record if the status of an action required in an assurance project as a result of evidence evaluation is pending or addressed.
The OPENCOSS platform shall show the actions required in an assurance project as a result of evidence evaluation.
The OPENCOSS platform shall show the actions required in an assurance project as a result of evidence item changes.
The OPENCOSS platform shall show the evidence items of an assurance project that are the source of evidence traceability links for which a given evidence item is the target.
The OPENCOSS platform shall show the evidence items of an assurance project that are the target of evidence traceability links for which a given evidence item is the source.
The OPENCOSS platform shall show the set of evidence items of an assurance projects by means of a tree-view.
The OPENCOSS platform shall store the CCL-information of the artefact to which an evidence item of an assurance project is associated.
The OPENCOSS platform shall store the characteristics of the evidence items of an assurance project according to the CCL.
The system shall monitor motion through cameras.
The system shall report motion and alert the responsible parties after analyzing the conditions without the aid of external motion detection sensors.

The system shall create a snapshot of the user’s usual average CPU utilization percentage, in order to subsequently be used as a basis for comparison, enabling the detection of the tremendous CPU load increase caused by cryptojacking.
The system shall produce a pop-up notification reporting the detected cryptojacking activity.
The system shall automatically send email alerts of detected cryptojacking activity.
The system should offer password strength measuring capability to suggest password security improvements to the user.
The system shall capture user’s keyboard typing pattern and mouse movement pattern during registration.
The system shall enable unique features to be extracted using datasets.
The system shall learn the user’s unique pattern using Naïve Bayes algorithms and store the template in the database.
The system shall give an update of balance left after every toll deduction by SMS reporting.
The system shall allow adding of a new user and updating current ones.
The system shall be able to show all the business units that are registered afore user make a selection.
The system shall be able to create reports from activity in the system.
The system shall allow entering the name of the individual whose details and PII are to be searched.
The system shall allow the web application access to the social sites public profiles.
The system shall allow Selenium scraping an individual’s personally identifiable information.
The system shall allow extraction of the personally identifiable information.
The system shall display the personally identifiable information on a graphical user interface.
The system shall access a profile from which the PII is scraped and displayed on the graphical user interface.
The system should be able to generate USSD codes for the transaction.
The system should be able to send the messages to the target number.
The system should be able to terminate transaction after ninety seconds of no response.
The system should flag a claim whose score exceeds the threshold.
System should allow users to download reports.
System shall allow user input of Licence number/National I.D Number/Registration Number.
The system shall allow the user to input the Licence number/national I.D Number of the driver in the system.
The system shall allow the user to capture Vehicle Registration Number using camera.
The system shall allow Fingerprint Verification of the Licence Owner.
The system shall allow the user to extract the Registration Number.
The system shall allow the user to query the database.
